titleInfo.title: Sheep Being Fed by a Nurse at the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society

physicalDescription.extent: 1 item (photograph), 10 x 8 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: Handwritten on envelope: ''#455 JCRS Farm''. On back of photograph: ''#455 JCRS ''Fag'' Ram being fed by nurse 1947''.

mods.abstract: A ram named Fag which belongs to the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS), appearing to be fed by a nurse. The JCRS was a sanatorium for tuberculosis patients that was founded in 1904 by a group of immigrant Jewish working men along with the support of several leading physicians and rabbis in Denver, Colorado. It was located on West Colfax Avenue just outside of Denver. This photograph has been manipulated by the photographer and is made up of several separate images that have been combined into one.
mods.note: Donated by AMC Cancer Research Center (JCRS).

titleInfo.title: Beck Archives Photograph Collection, Health Care and Philanthropy
